Microtiter Plate Well Identifiers

Source: R/microplate.R
microplate.Rd

Microtiter Plate Well Identifiers

microplate(plates = 1L, wells = 96L, controls = 0L, prefix = NULL)

Arguments

plates

scalar integer. Number of plates.
wells

scalar integer. Number of wells (96, 384).
controls

scalar integer. Number of control wells.
prefix

string or NULL. Plate name prefix.

Value

character. Well identifiers.

See also

Other Metadata Functions: detectHPC, detectLanes, detectOrganism, interestingGroups, minimalSampleData, organism, sampleData, sampleNames, uniteInterestingGroups

Examples

## Single 96-well plate.
microplate(wells = 96L)
#>  [1] "1-A01" "1-A02" "1-A03" "1-A04" "1-A05" "1-A06" "1-A07"
#>  [8] "1-A08" "1-A09" "1-A10" "1-A11" "1-A12" "1-B01" "1-B02"
#> [15] "1-B03" "1-B04" "1-B05" "1-B06" "1-B07" "1-B08" "1-B09"
#> [22] "1-B10" "1-B11" "1-B12" "1-C01" "1-C02" "1-C03" "1-C04"
#> [29] "1-C05" "1-C06" "1-C07" "1-C08" "1-C09" "1-C10" "1-C11"
#> [36] "1-C12" "1-D01" "1-D02" "1-D03" "1-D04" "1-D05" "1-D06"
#> [43] "1-D07" "1-D08" "1-D09" "1-D10" "1-D11" "1-D12" "1-E01"
#> [50] "1-E02" "1-E03" "1-E04" "1-E05" "1-E06" "1-E07" "1-E08"
#> [57] "1-E09" "1-E10" "1-E11" "1-E12" "1-F01" "1-F02" "1-F03"
#> [64] "1-F04" "1-F05" "1-F06" "1-F07" "1-F08" "1-F09" "1-F10"
#> [71] "1-F11" "1-F12" "1-G01" "1-G02" "1-G03" "1-G04" "1-G05"
#> [78] "1-G06" "1-G07" "1-G08" "1-G09" "1-G10" "1-G11" "1-G12"
#> [85] "1-H01" "1-H02" "1-H03" "1-H04" "1-H05" "1-H06" "1-H07"
#> [92] "1-H08" "1-H09" "1-H10" "1-H11" "1-H12"

## 2 96-well plates.
microplate(plates = 2L, wells = 96L)

## Single 384-well plate.
microplate(wells = 384L)
#>   [1] "1-A01" "1-A02" "1-A03" "1-A04" "1-A05" "1-A06" "1-A07"
#>   [8] "1-A08" "1-A09" "1-A10" "1-A11" "1-A12" "1-A13" "1-A14"

## 2 96-well plates with 6 control wells per plate.
microplate(plates = 2L, wells = 96L, controls = 6L)
#>   [1] "1-A07" "1-A08" "1-A09" "1-A10" "1-A11" "1-A12" "1-B01"
#>   [8] "1-B02" "1-B03" "1-B04" "1-B05" "1-B06" "1-B07" "1-B08"
#>  [15] "1-B09" "1-B10" "1-B11" "1-B12" "1-C01" "1-C02" "1-C03"
#>  [22] "1-C04" "1-C05" "1-C06" "1-C07" "1-C08" "1-C09" "1-C10"
#>  [29] "1-C11" "1-C12" "1-D01" "1-D02" "1-D03" "1-D04" "1-D05"
